gurmukhi: sIA Bjhu Awju huAY kY incIq ] sMGry rwm rx ieMdRjIq ]475]
transliteration: Seea Bhajoh Aaj(u) Huai Kai Nicheet|| Sandare Raam Ran Indrajeet||475||
translation: And he could certainly wed Sita on that day because Inderjit has killed ram in the war.475.

gurmukhi: qb khy bYx qiRjtI bulwie ] rx miRqk rwm sIqih idKwie ]
transliteration: Tab Kahe Bain Trijatee|| Ran Mritak Raam Seetah(i) Dikhaae||
translation: Then Ravana called the demoness named Trajata and asked her to show the dead Ram to Sita;

gurmukhi: lY geI nwQ jih igry Kyq ] miRg mwr isMG jXo supq Acyq ]476]
transliteration: Lai Gadnaath Jah(i) Gire Khet|| Mrig Maar Singh Jyo Soupat Achet||476||
translation: She rook away Sita from that place with her tantric power to the place where ram was sleeping in unconscious state like a lion after killing the deer.476.

gurmukhi: sIA inrK nwQ mn mih irswn ] ds Aaur cwr ib`idAw inDwn ]
transliteration: Seea Nirakh Naath Man Maih Reesaan|| Das Aur Chaar Biddeeaa Nidhaan||
translation: Seeing Ram in such a state, the mind of Sita was filled with extreme agony because Ram was the store-house of fourteen arts and it was impossible to make her believe in such an event;

gurmukhi: pV nwg mMqR sMGrI pws ] piq BRwq jXwie icq BXo hulws ]477]
transliteration: Pad Naag Mantra Sanharipaas|| Pat(i) Bhraat Juaae Chit Bhyo Hulaas||477||
translation: Sita went near Ram reciting Nagmantra and reviving both Ram and Lakshman her mind was filled with joy.477.

gurmukhi: sIA geI jgy AMgrwie rwm ] dl sihq BRwq juq Drm Dwm ]
transliteration: Seea Gadjage Anraae Raam|| Dal Sahit Bhraat Jout Dharam Dhaam||
translation: When Sita went back, Ram woke up alongwith his brother and forces.

gurmukhi: b`jy su nwid g`jy su bIr ] s`jy hiQXwr B`jy ADIr ]478]
transliteration: Bajje Su Naadh Gadje Su Beer|| Sajje Hathiyaar Bhajje Adheer||478||
translation: The brave fighters thundered bedecking themselves with weapons and the great warriors with power of endurance began to run away from the battlefield.478.

gurmukhi: sMmuly sUr sr brK ju`D ] hn swl qwl ibkRwl kRU`D ]
transliteration: Sanmule Soor Sar Barakh Juddh|| Han Saal Taal Bikraal Kruddh||
translation: The warriors with frightful prowess began to shower arrows in the war and being highly infuriated began to destroy even the trees;]

gurmukhi: qij ju`D su`D sur myG Drx ] Ql gXon kuMBlw hom krx ]479]
transliteration: Taj(i) Juddh Suddh Sur Megh Dharan|| Thal Gyon Kounbhlaa Hom Karan||479||
translation: At this time Inderjit Mehgnad forsook the war-arena and returned to perform the Hom Yajna (Sacrifice).479.

gurmukhi: lG bIr qIr lMkys Awn ] iem khY bYx qj BRwq kwn ]
transliteration: Lagh Beer Teer Lanks Aan|| Im Kahai Bain Taj Bhraat Kaan||
translation: Coming near the younger brother Vibhishan said that,

gurmukhi: Awie hY s`qRu ieh Gwq hwQ ] ieMdRwr bIr Arbr pRmwQ ]480]
transliteration: Aae Hai Sattru Eh Ghaat Haath|| Indraar Beer Arbar Pramaath||480||
translation: At that time his supreme enemy and the mighty warrior Inderjit is wwithing your ambush.480.

gurmukhi: inj mws kwt kr krq hom ] Qrhrq BUMim Ar ckq bXom ]
transliteration: Nij Maas Kaat Kar Karat Hom|| Thar-harat Bhoonm(i) Ar Chakat Byom||
translation: He is performing havana (sacrifice) by chopping his flesh, with which the whole earth is trembling and the sky is wondering.

gurmukhi: qh gXo rwm BRwqw insMig ] kr Dry DnK kt kis inKMg ]481]
transliteration: Tah Gado Raam Bhraataa Nisan(i)|| Kar Ddare Dhanakh Kat Kas(i) Nikhan||481
translation: Hearing this, Lakshman went there fearlessly with bow in his hand and quiver tied to his back.481.

gurmukhi: icMqI su icq dyvI pRcMf ] Ar hxXo bwx kIno duKMf ]
transliteration: Chintisu Chit Deviprachanndd|| Ar Hanyo Baan Keeno Doukhand||
translation: Inderjit began to recite for the manifestation of the goddess and Lakshman discharged his arrows and killed Inderjit into two halves.
